p: Studies reported the repressive effects of aryl hydrocarbon receptor (AhR) agonists on ERα estrogen-sensitive cancer (endometrium and breast) cells ( Tsuchiya et al., 2005; Okino et al., 2009; Marconett et al., 2010; Labrecque et al., 2012). In line with this, the agonistic properties of AEL and compounds were evaluated. AEL exhibited a dose-dependent and significant AhR β-galactosidase activity from 5 μg/ml. The activity at 83 μg/ml was similar to that of 50 nM β-naphthoflavone ( Ateba et al., 2013). For the first time, 44 (EC 50 not determined) and 73 (EC 50 of 1.34 µM) were found as partial agonists of AhR, whereas 43 was not active ( Ateba et al., 2014b).
